columns.name: certificate_arn
columns.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate. This is of the form: arn:aws:acm:region:123456789012:certificate/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012

columns.name: certificate
columns.description: The ACM-issued certificate corresponding to the ARN specified as input

columns.name: certificate_chain
columns.description: The ACM-issued certificate corresponding to the ARN specified as input

columns.name: domain_name
columns.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN), such as www.example.com or example.com, for the certificate

columns.name: certificate_transparency_logging_preference
columns.description: Indicates whether to opt in to or out of certificate transparency logging. Certificates that are not logged typically generate a browser error. Transparency makes it possible for you to detect SSL/TLS certificates that have been mistakenly or maliciously issued for your domain.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The time at which the certificate was requested. This value exists only when the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED

columns.name: subject
columns.description: The name of the entity that is associated with the public key contained in the certificate

columns.name: imported_at
columns.description: The name of the certificate authority that issued and signed the certificate

columns.name: issuer
columns.description: The name of the certificate authority that issued and signed the certificate

columns.name: signature_algorithm
columns.description: The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate

columns.name: extended_key_usages
columns.description: Specify one or more ExtendedKeyUsage extension values.

columns.name: failure_reason
columns.description: The reason the certificate request failed. This value exists only when the certificate status is FAILED

columns.name: issued_at
columns.description: A list of ARNs for the AWS resources that are using the certificate. A certificate can be used by multiple AWS resources

columns.name: status
columns.description: The status of the certificate

columns.name: key_algorithm
columns.description: The algorithm that was used to generate the public-private key pair

columns.name: not_after
columns.description: The time after which the certificate is not valid

columns.name: not_before
columns.description: The time before which the certificate is not valid

columns.name: renewal_eligibility
columns.description: Specifies whether the certificate is eligible for renewal.

columns.name: revocation_reason
columns.description: The reason the certificate was revoked. This value exists only when the certificate status is REVOKED

columns.name: revoked_at
columns.description: The time at which the certificate was revoked. This value exists only when the certificate status is REVOKED

columns.name: serial
columns.description: The serial number of the certificate

columns.name: type
columns.description: The source of the certificate. For certificates provided by ACM, this value is AMAZON_ISSUED.

columns.name: domain_validation_options
columns.description: Contains information about the initial validation of each domain name that occurs as a result of the RequestCertificate request. This field exists only when the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED

columns.name: in_use_by
columns.description: A list of ARNs for the AWS resources that are using the certificate

columns.name: subject_alternative_names
columns.description: One or more domain names (subject alternative names) included in the certificate. This list contains the domain names that are bound to the public key that is contained in the certificate. The subject alternative names include the canonical domain name (CN) of the certificate and additional domain names that can be used to connect to the website

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags associated with certificate
